message.content:
cs.HC, cs.GR, cs.RO, cs.SI, cs.CV 

This paper focuses on creating a hardware implementation of a surface friction display, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The study also involves exploring surfaces with an input device, which could fall under graphics (cs.GR) or robotics (cs.RO). Additionally, the study involves changing visual parameters to control the perceived sensation, which could fall under computer vision (cs.CV) or social and information networks (cs.SI) if the study involves analyzing user behavior and perception.
